simulated_ratings.title: Horseman on the Roof, The (Hussard sur le toit, Le) (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Period romance-adventure during war and plague isn’t my thing, though the historical backdrop is appealing.

simulated_ratings.title: Us (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Home-invasion horror with a mystery angle fits my taste for tense, eerie setups.

simulated_ratings.title: The Invitation (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A straight competition doc sounds solid but not especially gripping for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Bo Burnham: Inside (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A one-man lockdown special is interesting conceptually, but comedy-heavy pieces rarely wow me.

simulated_ratings.title: Snow Falling on Cedars (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A moody courtroom romance with buried secrets has potential, but I expect a measured, chilly payoff.

simulated_ratings.title: The Irishman (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mob history over decades interests me, but sprawling crime epics can feel overfamiliar.

simulated_ratings.title: Coup de torchon (Clean Slate) (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly comic crime morality tales are hit-or-miss for me.

simulated_ratings.title: War Zone, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak family drama with a secret sounds powerful but emotionally punishing.

simulated_ratings.title: Red Firecracker, Green Firecracker (Pao Da Shuang Deng) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Forbidden romance and duty-driven drama sound fine yet not especially compelling to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Tuvalu (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical, genre-blending fantasy-comedy isn’t my vibe despite the odd setting.

simulated_ratings.title: Black Mass (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: True-crime biopic terrain I’ve seen a lot of, so I expect solid but familiar beats.

simulated_ratings.title: Killer (Bulletproof Heart) (1994)

simulated_ratings.title: Zero Kelvin (Kjærlighetens kjøtere) (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A claustrophobic, psychological survival piece in harsh nature is right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Vanishing, The (Spoorloos) (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A minimalist abduction mystery with mounting dread is exactly the kind of slow-burn I like.

simulated_ratings.title: West Beirut (West Beyrouth) (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: War-torn coming-of-age with humor and romance sounds worthwhile but likely uneven for my tastes.

simulated_ratings.title: Funny Games (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Home-invasion cruelty and tense mind games align with my appetite for unsettling thrillers.

simulated_ratings.title: Color of Paradise, The (Rang-e khoda) (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Humanist family drama sounds tender but I lean toward darker material.

simulated_ratings.title: Dave Chappelle: The Age of Spin (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stand-up can be sharp, but I rarely love pure comedy specials.

simulated_ratings.title: See No Evil (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A blind protagonist stalked by a killer promises lean, effective suspense I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Parody-heavy broad comedy isn’t for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Incendies (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A mystery-driven journey through war and family secrets is the kind of heavy narrative I respond to.

simulated_ratings.title: My Life as a Dog (Mitt liv som hund) (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bittersweet coming-of-age drama sounds gentle and modestly affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: East is East (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Culture-clash family dramedy reads engaging but not my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: What Happened Was... (1994)

simulated_ratings.title: Radiohead: Meeting People Is Easy (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Process-focused tour documentary interests me without fully captivating.

simulated_ratings.title: Cloverfield (2008)

simulated_ratings.title: Alien: Covenant (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Shiny sci-fi horror on a dangerous planet sounds fine but not especially distinctive for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Quatermass and the Pit (1967)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Archaeological sci-fi mystery with psychic disturbances hits my sweet spot for eerie ideas.

simulated_ratings.title: Drop Dead Gorgeous (1999)

simulated_ratings.title: Mummy, The (1932)

simulated_ratings.title: Five Senses, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Interwoven, sense-themed vignettes sound modestly engaging if ultimately slight for my tastes.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridges of Madison County, The (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Zoolander (2001)

simulated_ratings.title: Your Friends and Neighbors (1998)
